content.question: The graph of <math alttext="f double prime" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>″</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, the second derivative of the function <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, is shown above on the interval <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to x, which is less than or equal to 6" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following could be the graph of <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 1 through 6, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The graph is a curve that begins just above the x axis, and just to the left of the y axis. It moves upward and to the right and reaches a maximum above the x axis, where x equals 1. The curve then moves downward and to the right, crossing the x axis approximately halfway between 2 and 3, and levels off as it reaches a minimum below the x axis, approximately halfway between x equals 4 and x equals 5. It then moves upward and to the right, crosses the x axis just to the left of 6, and ends just above the x axis.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 1 through 6, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The graph is a curve that begins just above the x axis, and just to the left of the y axis. It moves downward and to the right, crosses the origin and reaches a local minimum below the x axis, where x equals 1. The curve then moves upward and to the right, crossing the x axis at 2, and levels off as it reaches a maximum above the x axis, where x equals 4. It then moves downward and to the right, crosses the x axis approximately halfway between 5 and 6, and continues downward until it ends below the x axis.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 1 through 6, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The graph is a curve that begins just below the x axis, and just to the left of the y axis. It moves almost horizontally at first, crossing the y axis, and then moving downward and to the right. The curve levels off and reaches a minimum just below the x axis, where x equals 2. It then moves upward and to the right, crosses the x axis just to the right of 3, and continues upward until it levels off and reaches a maximum high above the x axis approximately halfway between x equals 5 and x equals 6. It moves downward briefly and ends above the x axis.

The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 1 through 6, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The graph is a curve that begins just below the x axis, and just to the left of the y axis. It moves gradually upward and levels off at the origin. It then moves downward and to the right until it levels off and reaches a local minimum far below the x axis, approximately halfway between x equals 2 and x equals 3. It then moves upward and to the right until it levels off and reaches a local maximum just below the x axis, approximately one third of the way between x equals 3 and x equals 4. The curve then moves downward and to the right until it levels off and reaches a local minimum approximately one third of the way between x equals 4 and x equals 5. It then moves upward and to the right, crosses the x axis just to the right of 5, and continues upward until it ends high above the x axis.

content.answer: The figure presents the graph of a curve in the x y coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The numbers 1 through 6, in increments of 1, are indicated on the x axis. The graph is a curve that begins just below the x axis, and just to the left of the y axis. It moves almost horizontally at first, crossing the y axis, and then moving downward and to the right. The curve levels off and reaches a minimum just below the x axis, where x equals 2. It then moves upward and to the right, crosses the x axis just to the right of 3, and continues upward until it levels off and reaches a maximum high above the x axis approximately halfway between x equals 5 and x equals 6. It moves downward briefly and ends above the x axis.

topic.text: 5.9: Connecting a Function, Its First Derivative, and Its Second Derivative

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
